info.title: Clockwork SMS
info.description: The HTTP interface to send text messages can be accessed using GET or POST. All parameters must be URL Encoded and sent as UTF-8 text.

get.description: The HTTP interface to send text messages can be accessed using GET or POST. All parameters must be URL Encoded and sent as UTF-8 text.

parameters.name: Content
parameters.description: The message you want to send. Mobile networks only support characters listed in the GSM character set, but for consistency all characters must be UTF-8 encoded when sending through the API.

parameters.name: From
parameters.description: The text or phone number displayed when a text message is received on a phone. This can be either a 12 digit number or 11 characters long. You can set a default by logging in to Clockwork.

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: Your API key, available by logging in (with your username and password) to Clockwork.

parameters.name: Long
parameters.description: Set this to 1 and weu2019ll stick together multiple messages giving you up to 459 characters, rather than the standard 160 (each recipient will cost up to 3 message credits)

parameters.name: total
parameters.description: Up to 50 comma separated numbers. Each number should start with an international country code without any leading zeros or plus symbols.
